verses.verse: Be not you envious<WH7065> against evil<WH7451> men,<WH582> neither<WH408> desire<WH183> to be with them.
For their heart<WH3820> studies<WH1897> destruction,<WH7701> and their lips<WH8193> talk<WH1696> of mischief.<WH5999>
Through wisdom<WH2451> is an house<WH1004> built;<WH1129> and by understanding<WH8394> it is established:<WH3559>
And by knowledge<WH1847> shall the chambers<WH2315> be filled<WH4390> with all<WH3605> precious<WH3368> and pleasant<WH5273> riches.<WH1952>
A wise<WH2450> man<WH1397> is strong;<WH5797> yes, a man<WH376> of knowledge<WH1847> increases<WH553> strength.<WH3581>
For by wise counsel<WH8458> you shall make your war:<WH4421> and in multitude<WH7230> of counsellors<WH3289> there is safety.<WH8668>
Wisdom<WH2454> is too high<WH7311> for a fool:<WH191> he opens<WH6605> not his mouth<WH6310> in the gate.<WH8179>
He that devises<WH2803> to do evil<WH7489> shall be called<WH7121> a mischievous<WH4209> person.<WH1167>
The thought<WH2154> of foolishness<WH200> is sin:<WH2403> and the scorner<WH3887> is an abomination<WH8441> to men.<WH120>
If you faint<WH7503> in the day<WH3117> of adversity,<WH6869> your strength<WH3581> is small.<WH6862>
If you forbear<WH2820> to deliver<WH5337> them that are drawn<WH3947> to death,<WH4194> and those that are ready<WH4131> to be slain;<WH2027>

If<WH3588> you say,<WH559> Behold,<WH2005> we knew<WH3045> it not; does not he that ponders<WH8505> the heart<WH3826> consider<WH995> it? and he that keeps<WH5341> your soul,<WH5315> does not he know<WH3045> it? and shall not he render<WH7725> to every man<WH120> according to his works?<WH6467>
My son,<WH1121> eat<WH398> you honey,<WH1706> because<WH3588> it is good;<WH2896> and the honeycomb,<WH5317> which is sweet<WH4966> to your taste:<WH2441>

So<WH3651> shall the knowledge<WH3045> of wisdom<WH2451> be to your soul:<WH5315> when<WH518> you have found<WH4672> it, then there shall be a reward,<WH319> and your expectation<WH8615> shall not be cut<WH3772> off.
Lay not wait,<WH693> O wicked<WH7563> man, against the dwelling<WH5116> of the righteous;<WH6662> spoil<WH7703> not his resting<WH7258> place:
For a just<WH6662> man falls<WH5307> seven<WH7651> times, and rises<WH6965> up again: but the wicked<WH7563> shall fall<WH3782> into mischief.<WH7451>
Rejoice<WH8055> not when your enemy<WH341> falls,<WH5307> and let not your heart<WH3820> be glad<WH1523> when he stumbles:<WH3782>
Lest<WH6435> the LORD<WH3068> see<WH7200> it, and it displease<WH7489> <WH5869> him, and he turn<WH7725> away his wrath<WH639> from him.
Fret<WH2734> not yourself because of evil<WH7489> men, neither<WH408> be you envious<WH7065> at the wicked:<WH7563>
For there shall be no<WH3808> reward<WH319> to the evil<WH7451> man; the candle<WH5216> of the wicked<WH7563> shall be put<WH1846> out.
My son,<WH1121> fear<WH3372> you the LORD<WH3068> and the king:<WH4428> and meddle<WH6148> not with them that are given to change:<WH8138>
For their calamity<WH343> shall rise<WH6965> suddenly;<WH6597> and who<WH4310> knows<WH3045> the ruin<WH6365> of them both?<WH8147>
These<WH428> things also<WH1571> belong to the wise.<WH2450> It is not good<WH2896> to have respect<WH5234> of persons<WH6440> in judgment.<WH4941>
He that said<WH559> to the wicked,<WH7563> You are righteous;<WH6662> him shall the people<WH5971> curse,<WH5344> nations<WH3816> shall abhor<WH2194> him:
But to them that rebuke<WH3198> him shall be delight,<WH5276> and a good<WH2896> blessing<WH1293> shall come<WH935> on them.
Every man shall kiss<WH5401> his lips<WH8193> that gives a right<WH5228> answer.<WH7725> <WH1697>
Prepare<WH3559> your work<WH4399> without,<WH2351> and make it fit<WH6257> for yourself in the field;<WH7704> and afterwards<WH310> build<WH1129> your house.<WH1004>
Be not a witness<WH5707> against your neighbor<WH7453> without<WH2600> cause;<WH2600> and deceive<WH6601> not with your lips.<WH8193>
Say<WH559> not, I will do<WH6213> so<WH3651> to him as he has done<WH6213> to me: I will render<WH7725> to the man<WH376> according to his work.<WH6467>
I went<WH5674> by the field<WH7704> of the slothful,<WH6102> and by the vineyard<WH3754> of the man<WH120> void<WH2638> of understanding;<WH3820>

And, see,<WH2009> it was all<WH3605> grown<WH5927> over<WH5927> with thorns,<WH7063> and nettles<WH2738> had covered<WH3680> the face<WH6440> thereof, and the stone<WH68> wall<WH1444> thereof was broken<WH2040> down.<WH2040>
Then I saw,<WH2372> and considered<WH7896> <WH3820> it well: I looked<WH7200> on it, and received<WH3947> instruction.<WH4148>
Yet a little<WH4592> sleep,<WH8142> a little<WH4592> slumber,<WH8572> a little<WH4592> folding<WH2264> of the hands<WH3027> to sleep:<WH7901>
So<WH3651> shall your poverty<WH7389> come<WH935> as one that travels;<WH1980> and your want<WH4270> as an armed<WH4043> man.<WH376>
